The Last of Us 2 represents how games sh: As a fan of the first game and someone that wasn't spoiled by the leaks I can can whole heartedly say I was not disappointed. Joel's death is not some pointless attempt at shock value as everyone wants to believe. Its creates interesting\, reoccurring themes within the story (those being revenge\, hate and forgiveness)\, it gives Ellie a complex character arc\, it kicks off a brutal journey for us the player to go on and is a perfect way to continue the story beats of the first game. To be fair\, her segment does go on too long but stick to it. Trust me you'll understand why you have to see Abby's perspective by the end. The only way I feel I can some up my feeling towards Abby's and her segment it that I said \"I don't want to kill Abby!\" aloud durring the final fight.
